ygData.subject: RE: [EverQuest] I hate Shadows of Luclin and I don't even own it 	 yet...
ygData.msgSnippet: from an online perspective Blizzards way sucks ass. The shher volume of people who hack the game is enormous and gives you almost endless ways to hack the
ygData.messageBody:
from an online perspective Blizzards way sucks ass. The shher volume of
people who hack the game is enormous and gives you almost endless ways to
hack the game. Verants approach at least locks down a lot more of the
possibilities. (Not saying its tamper-proof, its not) but still better by a
mile.

Cant really compare an online to offline approach.

/Alex

-----Original Message-----
From: Su [mailto:suceress@...]
Sent: Wednesday, December 12, 2001 3:39 PM
To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [EverQuest] I hate Shadows of Luclin and I don't even own
it yet...



Well, I wish they would do things more like Blizzard with Diablo where you
can choose to have offline characters and not have to worry about upgrading.
And I really wish they were as friendly as Maxis. One of the reasons I love
the Sims is that they actually encourage you to make new items for your
characters.
luv,
-Su

> well. To not afford any upgrades at all isnt really Verants problem
(imho).
> Its just how the business works, try to be happy that they actually change
> and evolve the game. Else go to the budget shelfs and get some cheap 2
year
> old game, that will work fine on your old system.
>
> Its like saying I dont want anything to change cause im not ready for it.
> Bite down, dont drink beer for 1 month and you got the cash. Called
> priorities in 99% of all cases.
>
> Might sound harsh, not intended to.
>
> /Alex
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Su [mailto:suceress@...]
> Sent: Wednesday, December 12, 2001 1:29 PM
> To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: Re: [EverQuest] I hate Shadows of Luclin and I don't even own
> it yet...
>
>
>
> Well, some people can barely afford the computers they have as well as
> Everquest, much less afford to upgrade...
> Verant should work harder on making the game compatible with lower end
> systems rather than forcing their customers to upgrade or quit.
> luv,
> -Su
>
> > Hardware is fairly inexpensive these days. If your into computers and
> games
> > in particular you will have to stay slightly ahead of the curve.
> Currently
> > you can pick up memory pretty cheap.. I got mine from googlegear.com..
> They
> > have 512megs of memory for as low as 60$ Keep in mind that only a few
> years
> > ago that could have cost you up to 1$ per meg. Besides they released
the
> > requirements for Luclin months ago, there was time to upgrade prior.
You
> > can still certainly play the previous Everquest as well as the prior
> > expansions without changing much if anything.. If it's the directx 8
> > problem, you can pick up compatiable cards (geforce2 MXs) for as low as
> 35$.
> >
> >
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: alexander.jones@...
> > [mailto:alexander.jones@...]
> > Sent: Tuesday, December 11, 2001 4:23 AM
> > To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
> > Subject: RE: [EverQuest] I hate Shadows of Luclin and I don't even own
it
> > yet...
> >
> >
> > Old puters work just fine. The only problem you have is that your video
> card
> > *MUST* be dx8 certified. Other than that even going as low as 128 megs
> will
> > work. There is not the slightest chance in hell you can install luclin
on
> > that machine tho, cause it will die while trying to render the new
> graphics.
> >
> > And you should really get more ram, it isnt that expensive. Ram and a
nice
> > video card and everything works a lot smoother. CPU power isnt that
> > important.
> >
> > 512mb for $100 isnt steep. And your machine needs to be nicely
configured.
> > For example if you run WinXP old world eq and me would be like 256 megs
to
> > run ok but on 98 128 works ok and 160 is fine.
> >
> > And dont be so negative, SoL is a whopping expansion worth the new
specs.
> > Graphics are cool (some char models are a bit weird) but
mobs/surrondings
> > are very nice. The mob features are a LOT improved adding more tactics
to
> > fights.
> >
> > /Alex
> >
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: Su [mailto:suceress@...]
> > Sent: den 11 december 2001 10:02

> time

that
